title: ðŸ—ï¸ The System Architect
description: Design a complex system with multiple interacting components!
startingCode:
# Create a library management system with:
# Book class with title, author, ISBN
# Library class to manage books
# User class for borrowing books
# Methods for adding, removing, borrowing, returning books
solutionCode:
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

class Book:
    def __init__(self, title, author, isbn):
        self.title = title
        self.author = author
        self.isbn = isbn
        self.is_borrowed = False
        self.borrowed_by = None
        self.due_date = None
    
    def __str__(self):
        return f'{self.title} by {self.author}'

class User:
    def __init__(self, name, user_id):
        self.name = name
        self.user_id = user_id
        self.borrowed_books = []
    
    def borrow_book(self, book):
        if not book.is_borrowed:
            book.is_borrowed = True
            book.borrowed_by = self.user_id
            book.due_date = datetime.now() + timedelta(days=14)
            self.borrowed_books.append(book)
            print(f'{self.name} borrowed {book}')
            return True
        else:
            print(f'{book} is already borrowed')
            return False
    
    def return_book(self, book):
        if book in self.borrowed_books:
            book.is_borrowed = False
            book.borrowed_by = None
            book.due_date = None
            self.borrowed_books.remove(book)
            print(f'{self.name} returned {book}')
            return True
        else:
            print(f'{self.name} hasn\'t borrowed {book}')
            return False

class Library:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name
        self.books = []
        self.users = []
    
    def add_book(self, book):
        self.books.append(book)
        print(f'Added {book} to library')
    
    def remove_book(self, isbn):
        for book in self.books:
            if book.isbn == isbn:
                self.books.remove(book)
                print(f'Removed {book} from library')
                return True
        print(f'Book with ISBN {isbn} not found')
        return False
    
    def register_user(self, user):
        self.users.append(user)
        print(f'Registered user: {user.name}')
    
    def list_available_books(self):
        available = [book for book in self.books if not book.is_borrowed]
        print('Available books:')
        for book in available:
            print(f'  - {book}')
        return available

# Demo the system
library = Library('Central Library')

# Add books
book1 = Book('The Hobbit', 'J.R.R. Tolkien', '978-0547928227')
book2 = Book('Python Programming', 'John Doe', '978-1234567890')
library.add_book(book1)
library.add_book(book2)

# Register user
user = User('Alice', 'U001')
library.register_user(user)

# Borrow and return books
user.borrow_book(book1)
library.list_available_books()
user.return_book(book1)
library.list_available_books()

testCases.expectedOutput:
Added The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien to library
Added Python Programming by John Doe to library
Registered user: Alice
Alice borrowed The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien
Available books:
  - Python Programming by John Doe
Alice returned The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien
Available books:
  - The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien
  - Python Programming by John Doe
